InputInfoPanel.panel.infoPanelTextBundle:
The input should be a simple .txt file.
The file should consist of two or more points, each on its own line.Each point should be made up of a station ID, a geometry ID, three coordinates: x, y and z and a standard deviation. These should be simple numbers.
Example:
1000 3 23.5 33.3 45.7 0.1
1000 2 5.5 3.3 7.7 0.1
2000 3 33.5 43.3 55.7 0.1
1000 5 16.5 44.3 34.7 0.1 
2000 2 15.5 13.3 17.7 0.1
2000 5 26.5 54.3 44.7 0.1
InputInfoPanel.panel.infoPanelTextFive:
The input should be a simple .txt file.
The file should consist of five or more points, each on its own line.Each point should be made up of three coordinates: x, y and z. These should be simple numbers.
Example:
41.3 11.2 17.1
24.2 33.1 19.8
9.1 5.4 12.9
InputInfoPanel.panel.infoPanelTextFour:
The input should be a simple .txt file.
The file should consist of four or more points, each on its own line.Each point should be made up of three coordinates: x, y and z. These should be simple numbers.
Example:
41.3 11.2 17.1
24.2 33.1 19.8
9.1 5.4 12.9
InputInfoPanel.panel.infoPanelTextOne:
The input should be a simple .txt file.
The file should consist of one or more points, each on its own line.Each point should be made up of three coordinates: x, y and z. These should be simple numbers.
Example:
41.3 11.2 17.1
24.2 33.1 19.8
9.1 5.4 12.9
InputInfoPanel.panel.infoPanelTextThree:
The input should be a simple .txt file.
The file should consist of three or more points, each on its own line.Each point should be made up of three coordinates: x, y and z. These should be simple numbers.
Example:
41.3 11.2 17.1
24.2 33.1 19.8
9.1 5.4 12.9
